sentences.sContent: Boyd’s goal secured his team’s place in the Cup Final.
sentences.sCn: 博伊德的进球确保了球队进入足总杯决赛。

sentences.sContent: Negotiators are still working to secure the hostages’ release.
sentences.sCn: 谈判人员仍在努力争取人质获释。

sentences.sContent: Redgrave won his third Olympic gold medal, and secured his place in history .
sentences.sCn: 雷德格雷夫赢得了个人第三枚奥运会金牌，使自己的名字载入了史册。

synos.tran: 安全的；无虑的；有把握的；稳当的
获得安全；船抛锚；停止工作

words.tran: 安全的；可靠的（secure的比较级形式）
安全地；牢固地；安心地；有把握地

trans.tranOther: to get or achieve something that will be permanent, especially after a lot of effort
safe from and protected against damage or attack
